thread.title: ‘EastEnders' Spoilers: From Phil Mitchell To Bobby Beale, The 5 Characters To Watch Out For This Winter
thread.title_full: ‘EastEnders' Spoilers: From Phil Mitchell To Bobby Beale, The 5 Characters To Watch Out For This Winter

author: Rachel McGrath
title: ‘EastEnders' Spoilers: From Phil Mitchell To Bobby Beale, The 5 Characters To Watch Out For This Winter
text:
Previous Story Next Story ‘EastEnders' Spoilers: From Phil Mitchell To Bobby Beale, The 5 Characters To Watch Out For This Winter   | By Rachel McGrath reddit 
‘EastEnders’ bosses have teaser what’s to come in the next few months, revealing that there’ll be plenty of drama for a number of characters. 
The action is set to kick off with a huge, hour-long Halloween special and the next months will see Phil Mitchell and Bobby Beale among the characters thrust into the spotlight. 
Speaking at an ‘EastEnders’ press event, soap boss Dominic Treadwell-Collins teased what fans need to watch out for… 
1. Phil Mitchell 
The Halloween episode will see drama for Kathy Beale, Ben and Phil Mitchell, and Dominic revealed that this is the start of a difficult period for Steve McFadden’s character. 
2. Bobby Beale 
Jane has struggled to cope with Bobby 
Quite frankly, we’re still reeling from the news that Bobby murdered his sister Lucy, and in the months since the revelation was made during live week, viewers have seen Bobby continue to cause problems for his family. 
Now, Dominic has hinted that we’re going to see an even darker side to the youngster, stating: “Bobby is definitely one to watch, as you’ll see… he’s a little bit of a little bastard! That story is going to reach its climax at Christmas.” 
3. The Carters 
The Carters have had quite the ride since arriving in Walford two Christmases ago, and Dominic addressed rumours of a confrontation between Dean and Mick Carter. 
“Whitney’s behind the bar more and builds her relationship with Lee,” Dominic teased. “Then there’s Christmas with Dean and the not-so-secret Carters’ New Year wedding, which will be filmed in a couple of weeks time… with wetsuits!” 
Lee's depression has escalated in recent months 
4. Vincent Hubbard 
Vincent’s been a man of mystery, who clearly has plenty of secrets, and it looks like we’ll finally be getting to find out some of them. 
“There's big stuff for Vincent over the next few months with his feud with Ronnie,” the executive producer said. "We're going to find out a lot more about Vincent. So far he's been a little bit intriguing, but we're about to find out exactly what's going on behind those glaring eyes." 
5. Stacey Branning 
Martin is set to pop the question to Stacey on Halloween - but will she say yes? There have also been a number of questions over the paternity of her baby. James Bye, who plays Martin, previously revealed his thoughts on the storyline, stating: “He’s head over heels in love with her and starting to feel that in return. He’s got a unit which is what he wants. For him to find out that it’s not his…” Eeeek! 
Catch up on all the latest ‘EastEnders’ news and spoilers here . Close 'EastEnders' Storylines You've Probably Forgotten of   With the help of Sean, Tanya came up with a plan to get rid of her cheating husband for good. Well... Until she had a change of heart and dug him back up. Well, there's not much to say about this is there? that gravelly voice never gets boring, does it? Is there anyway Beppe can come back? Letitia Dean and Paul Medford's characters entered a battle of the bands competition back in 1986, and the song was released by the BBC in real life, landing them at number 12 in the charts. Phil's serious drug use storyline was somewhat undermined by the fact his addiction lasted for approximately 10 days... We all remember 'Who shot Phil?', but what about when Jane was fired at by her step-son? This emotional storyline tackled a number of key issues, bringing mental health issues into the spotlight. Remember him?! Remember Ashley Cotton? The youngster brought some light into grandma Dot's life - until Nick intervened and ruined things... After agreeing to give her baby to Jane, Lucy decided to have a secret termination, agreeing with Ian that they would tell Jane it was a miscarriage. Why are Jane and Ian getting married again? Bianca and Carol may have patched up their differences in recent years, but things were very different in 1999, when they both stared relationships with the same man. Those were the days... (SPOILER: It obviously did not work out well for them...) As weird romances go, this was certainly one of the best... There's a reason the role of Ben Mitchell has been recast so many times, and this serious storyline was transformed into a rather ridiculous one, thanks to the not-so-great acting from this young star.  Share
